messages.subject: Re: Homeschooling across the US!
messages.msgSnippet: Aimee - Sorry for the delay in this post... I m still a couple weeks behind in reading all the email digests from my homeschool lists... I m so envious of your
messages.messageBody:
Aimee -
 
Sorry for the delay in this post... I'm still a couple weeks behind in reading all the email digests from my homeschool lists...
 
I'm so envious of your upcoming trip!  What are you driving - a car? RV?
 
I live in Orlando, Florida.  Outside the theme parks, our favorites are Green Meadow Petting Farm, and the Orlando Science Center. St.Augustine is a nice historical site, and Tampa has a lot to do as well. 
 
The kids and I spend our summers at my family's camp in Lake George, NY.  There's a lot of history here - Fort William Henry, Fort Ticonderoga, Saratoga Historic Battlefield Park... from Fort Ticonderoga you can take a ferry into Vermont, where we've done the Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream Factory Tour, Vermont Teddy Bear Company, and strawberry picking. 
 
We've also traveled quite a bit - spent two weeks in Arizona this past January, been to Washington DC a few times, Hawaii for two weeks a couple years ago, and Alaska in May.  I've kept journals from all these trips, so if you'd like more information, just write me at RNorell@... and I'll email the journals to you!
 
Looking forward to hearing more about your plans!
 
Robin
Orlando, FL (and Lake George, NY)
 :-)
